windows.symptom: During upgrade to win10 used hard disk as the flash boot and 20 years of all my family movies and photos lost forever. solutions: You guys there, be aware, there is no warning that it will format the usb device.20 years of information deleted in seconds.Still can't forgive myself not uploading all information to a cloud.Two points:If you were able to run your PC for 20 years without any backup to an independent medium then you were very, very lucky. Important data must at all times be stored on at least two independent media.The warning you mention was there all along:

Flashing DNS on WIndows 10        Flashing DNS on Windows 10, are there resulting problems for my computer?
solutions: Hey RWA_821, nope, when you flash the DNS cache, requesting new websites might take a bit longer in theory, but it's unnoticeable..cache will be rebuilt automaticallySo in short, no harm will happen if you flush your dns cache.

windows.symptom: I have to enter my PIN constantly ...any ideas ...i can't find this in settings        I can't stop my laptop from constantly asking for my PIN ...any ideas ...cant find anything in settings
solutions: Hi Cody. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.If you want to remove the PIN go to Settings > Accounts > Sign in Options, but it will still prompt for password.You can skip the Sign-in screen altogether following this: https://www.tekrevue.com/tip/skip-windows-10-lo...Then turn off prompt for PIN/password after you've been away from PC and it sleeps or suspends in Settings > Accounts > Sign in Options.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.
Hello,If you're comfortable using password, go to Settings > Accounts > Sign in Options and clickRemove under PIN. Regards.
that worked !! thanks so much. One other question. I have Microsoft Word stuck on open on the task bar.  It says there is a dialog box open ? I can't close it for anything. Any ideas?thanks very much

windows.symptom: Insuffcient memory and not enough memory        Running Windows 10 on both my desktop and laptop. On my desktop I got and error "not enough memory" while editing in Canon Digital Photo Professional. On my laptop I got the error "insufficient memory" while running Adobe Lightroom Classic. Is this Microsoft update related? I ran disk cleanup, disk defrag, deleted temporary internet files, cleared out more space on my hard drive even though it already had enough space and reinstalled Digital Photo Professional but it didn't help. Both my laptop and desktop are having problems. The memory diagnostic tool didn't find anything wrong. Is this update related? Help!
solutions: Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.I believe this error will be relating to RAM rather than disk space. Using disk cleanup, etc. won’t help this.Your best solution would be to first of all close an many open applications as you can whilst running there that you have have an issue with. Alternative, if possible, you could try upgrade you PC/laptop with more RAM.Regards, Ross
My desktop has 8 GB and my laptop has 12. This is a recent problem. I don't have too many programs running.

I am unsure of what would have changed recently, as there are a lot of variable which can affect the amount of memory available, including the actual images you are working on.I’ve located a thread where a user is having a similar issue and there are a number of suggestions relating to lightroom in particular here:https://community.adobe.com/t5/lightroom-classi...Regards, Ross Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

I think the issue relates to virtual memory since I recently decreased it on both machines. I just increased it and will see how it goes. I wasn't having any issues before I decreased it. Since my last update was a few weeks ago I don't think that was the cause.
Hi Richard, That’s almost certainly the issue, I would recommend either keeping the setting at automatic, or if you still have issues manually increasing the size.Regards, Ross

I have to do the above to activates it.Yesterday everything was fine, but today it started doing this. BUT when i restarted my laptop, it was fine for 1 minute and BOOM BACK TO ANNOYING. HELP!
solutions: Hi Nelsonkth, my name is Jay. I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.Can you please check if your "Sticky Keys" Control Panel\Ease of Access\Ease of Access Center\Set up Filter Keys" is enabled?To do that please go to Control Panel> Ease of Access> Ease of Access Center> Make the keyboard easier to use and if the box beside Turn on Sticky Keys, Turn on Toggle Keys, and Turn on Filter Keys have a check mark? Hi Nelsonkth, Apologies as my instruction was not complete, can you also check if there is a check mark in the box beside "Turn on sticky keys" that has "Press keyboard shortcuts (such as CTRL+ALT+DEL) one key at a time" in Set up Sticky Keys settings?To check it, please go to: Control Panel> Ease of Access> Ease of Access Center> Set up Sticky Keys Please make sure to save the changes. You may also send a screenshot of your current settings, thank you.Regards, Jay

Hi Nelson, Can you try going to search and type in Sticky Keys> select "Turn on easy access keys" - from here you should be able to see "Make it easier to type> "Press keyboard shortcuts (such as CTRL+ALT+DEL) one key at a time"> click on "Set up Sticky Keys" settings> uncheck box "Press keyboard shortcuts (such as CTRL+ALT+DEL) one key at a time" You may also check this article on ways to disable sticky keys, when using shift option, make sure to select no once the prompt appears for you to disable it. I appreciate your patience on this, thank you.Regards, Jay

windows.symptom: full scree problem        my laptop is working on windows 10 operating system.i am faced problem my laptop screen is not adjusted full screen in different screen resolutions'it adjust full screen in 1900 X 1080 resolution. how to fix it.
solutions: Hi nagendra Do you mean you have a black border around your screen, or the whole image does not fit on your screen?If so, this is not caused by resolution, this is caused by the aspect ratio setting . ..Right click your Desktop, on the resulting menu, you should see the control panel for your graphics card (Intel HD . . etc.) open thatOn that control Panel, look for an Aspect Ratio setting and try each option there to find the option that fits your screen . . .

Simply select the Settings and more menu and click the “Full screen” arrows icon, or press “F11” on your keyboard. Full screen mode hides things like the address bar and other items from view so you can focus on your content.To exit full screen mode, move your mouse near top of the screen or swipe down with your finger and select the “restore” icon in the top-right, or press “F11” again.Source: [link removed by moderator]

windows.symptom: How to find PIN for bluetooth?        Trying to pair PC and laptop
solutions: Hi Mike,I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 2-Year Windows Insider MVP here to help.The PIN either is automatically shown on either one and you have to press yes or it is usually 12345 for most of the devices. Have you tried the same?

Hello,While you pair these devices, the PIN will be automatically displayed on screen. Keep both devices Bluetooth on and search for another from one. Repeat this from another device if that doesn't work. Once both devices detect each other, you may see PIN displayed on screen of either device.Regards.
I tried 1234 but I will try 12345
No pin was displayed on either device. My win10 pc with bluetooth adapter showed bluetooth active but not pairing with laptop.
Also try 00000 and 123456 if it doesn't work.
Okay, will do.

windows.symptom: App keeps reappearing after I permanently delete it        Hi people,I have a Bible app that keeps redownloading after I permanently delete all the relating files as well as the app. I feel like I've gotten rid of the entire app and the files, but after a short while, the app comes back and I have to keep re-deleting everything again, which is really time-consuming. I definitely know that the app was not preinstalled. Is there a quicker way I can permanently delete the app without it ever reappearing again or am I doing something wrong?Thanks for the help
solutions: Hi, My name is Gary an independent advisor and I would be happy to help you out with your concern,Did you download the app from the Microsoft store? If so, 1. Open the start menu and locate powershell and run it with admin permisison 2. Execute this command to receive its package name Get-AppxPackage *Bible* Upon receiving its package name execute this command Get-AppxPackage *theapp'spackagename* | Remove-AppxPackageUpon successfully uninstalling the app, perform disable third party services or aps from startup that may be causing the issues1. Go to start menu/search msconfig 2. On the system configuration window go to the services tab 3. Tick on hide all microsoft service so that this won't be affected 4. Choose to disable all services 5. Next, go to the startup tab and on the window choose to open task manager 6. Choose to disable each applications from starting up when computer is booting up7. Close task manager and hit apply then ok 8. A prompt to restart the computer will show up, choose to restart Let me know how it goes. :)

Hi Gary,I am able to receive the package name, but after I execute the second command and press enter, nothing happens and the app does not uninstall. I know I am typing it exactly as you've put it.Btw, thanks for responding:)

Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.I think the issue you are having with the second command is the name of the app retrieved from the first step.Can you substitute: *theapp'spackagename* With the exact spelling (case sensitive) of the app retrieved from step 1, enclosed in double quotes (")Regards, Ross

windows.symptom: RunDLL Error        I have an HP 7510 printer. Every time I open up my laptop  I get this message.(There was a problem starting C:\Program Files\HP\HP Photosmart 7510 series\bin\HPStatusBL.dll The specific module could not be found) When I go to print it will only print one at a time and then it holds the file in print queue and does not let me print again. I have tried deleting and reloading still the same problem. I have to wait in between printing for the file name to drop off before doing another printing.
solutions: Hello ElizN, I am Andrew an independent advisor. DLL errors are often associated within Windows. Did you delete and reload the printers programming or the file you were printing?If it was not the printers programming please delete and reinstall it using the latest software version found here.https://support.hp.com/us-en/drivers/selfservic...If you've already tried this method we need to scan Windows for any errors using these,In the search bar, type cmd. Right-click on cmd.exe and select Run as Administrator. Type SFC /scannow and press the Enter key. Re-enter Command Prompt as Administrator and run these: dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /scanhealth dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup Please try these suggestions and let us know they results. Andrew Disclaimer: Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Creating Backup to an External drive issue        I received an error code 0x80070032 when setting up a backup file to an external hard drive. Could you help me?
solutions: Hi, My name is Nick and I am an Independent Advisor. Check if the services related to Backup and Restore are up and running. Please find the instructions to follow below.1) Press Windows logo key + R and open Run dialog box 2) Type in services.msc and tap on OK 3) The following services should be running: Windows Event Log, Task Scheduler, Windows Backup.4) Double click on each service locate Automatic from the drop-down for Startup type and click on Start5) Once the service is started, click on OK Are you using Anti-virus software? If yes, try disabling it temporarily then check if Backup works.

windows.symptom: tones play continuously        In Windows 10 the device connect tone, then the device disconnect tone, play continuously.  How can I find out what is causing them to do that?  How can I get them to stop?
solutions: Hi Garvin, Let's try to fix this: I have 'fixed' the issue by disabling the USB selective suspend setting! Haven't heard any device connect/disconnect sounds in a while.Go to Start > type in Edit Power Settings > Click the icon > go to Change Advanced Power Settings >Then under 'USB settings', under "USB selective suspend setting' set it to 'Disabled' (for both if you have a laptop)Restart and try.

I set the USB selective suspend setting to Disabled.  The display went off after 10 minutes as I had set it before.  After the display went off the connect/disconnect sounds began, as usual.  So this didn't work.  Nice try, though!  Thanks for the help.

OK let's check something else, go to Start > type in Device Manager > go to Device Manager > under Universal Serial Bus Controllers can you take a screenshot of that and send it to me? I want to see if there is an issue there...

OK let's check something else, go to Start > type in Device Manager > go to Device Manager > under Universal Serial Bus Controllers can you take a screenshot of that and send it to me? I want to see if there is an issue there...
Could you possibly uninstall all those USB devices, restart your computer and let Windows install the driver again - there may be an issue with them

Could you possibly uninstall all those USB devices, restart your computer and let Windows install the driver again - there may be an issue with themThe problem turned out to be completely uninvolved with USB ports.  My monitor was too old to be supported by Windows 10, and a generic driver was installed, but Windows 10 continued to poll all monitor ports continuously, thus the constant device connect/disconnect sounds.  I updated to a more recent monitor and installed the correct driver for that monitor, and the problem was solved.  Thanks for your suggestions.

windows.symptom: after a windows 10 update in september my operating system is gone        after a windows 10 update in september my operating system is gone, I tried talking to the service department at Microsoft and could not get someone who spoke good english and I could not understand them, the problem was never resolved and I still cannot use that computer, the usb that we made on one of the many calls does not work it says that there is an error code: OXC0000098, missing boot\BCD\. I have ordered a new hard drive. How can I get windows 10 without paying another $119.00 for it, to install on my new hard drive? Thank you for your help
solutions: Hi Dianne. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.The license you have is good for the life of the motherboard. You can reinstall WIndows as often as you want.If the hard drive is failing I'd replace it with an SSD which is the best upgrade you can give your PC - lightning fast, better than a new higher end PC without one.Follow the included instructions or a video you find for your model via Google to swap it in and do this Clean Install which should get you past all difficulties as it has hundreds of thousands of others who have followed the steps in this link and never come back to report another problem: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... To create bootable Windows 10 Installation Media (on another PC if necessary) install Media Creation Tool and follow the directions in the middle of the download page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key for your PC maker given in this chart:https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first.Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Install Now, then Custom Install, then at the drive selection screen delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest, select the Unallocated Space, click Next to let it create and format the needed partitions and start install - this makes it foolproof.You will get and keep the best possible install to the exact extent you stick with the steps, tools and methods in the linked tutorial. It's a better install than any amount of money could buy and a great learning experience that will make you the master of your PC because you will learn everything that works best and how to apply it with your own hands.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

If the computer was activated there is no longer a need for a key.If asked for a key just go to the bottom of the page and click on Skip, Do this later, or I do not have one. When you make the USB you need to use Rufus to make it bootable and then install Windows 10.If you used the media creation tool and downloaded to the computer click on Upgrade.
what is Rufus?
Rufus is an item that will make you USB bootabe.  Also make sure that the USB is at the top of the BIOS boot list.

I have installed the new hard drive and when I tried to install the windows 10 I get a message "We couldn't find any drives. To get a storage drive, click load driver."  When I click on load driver I get a message " to install the device driver for your drive, insert installation media containing device files and click OK . there was NO media that came with this new hard drive, so now what do I do?
